hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point jump signals fresh confidence that Congress will actually fund DHS before the deadline, likely driven by behind-the-scenes deal-making and traders ditching their "government always brinks-manships-to-the-wire" playbook. At 54.6%, the market's barely pricing in the chaos tax of a real shutdown, so if we hit late March with zero framework, you're looking at 35-40% as the real floor.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Odds Jump 10 Points, Market Pricing Deal by Easter
daily_take.deck: The shutdown resolution market rocketed 10 percentage points to 54.6% in 24 hours, suggesting fresh deal momentum on the Hill. That's a 5-to-1 split bet now, which feels reasonable given Republicans control both chambers and Trump wants a win before the 2026 midterms heat up. The real play: if you're seeing insider chatter about a framework, the current price leaves you roughly 50-50 on a deal before March 31. That's sharp enough to pass unless you have better intel than the market does.
